data.title: Adoor Gopalakrishnan, the recipient of Padma Vibhushan Award, 2006 is associated with which one of the following fields ?
data.text: Adoor Gopalakrishnan, who was awarded the Padma Vibhushan in 2006, is associated with the field of art. The Padma Vibhushan is the second-highest civilian award in India, and it is given to individuals who have made valuable contributions in various fields. Adoor Gopalakrishnan is a renowned Indian film director, screenwriter, and producer, primarily working in Malayalam cinema. He is considered one of the pioneers of parallel cinema in India. Parallel cinema is a genre of filmmaking that is known for its realistic and socially relevant themes, focusing on the struggles of ordinary people. Adoor Gopalakrishnan`s films often address important social issues and showcase a deep understanding of human emotions. His work has been widely recognized and acclaimed, both nationally and internationally, making him one of the most respected figures in Indian cinema.
